data.title: Outstanding music teachers
data.meta_description: With Varsity Arts coverage coming to an end, we asked Orange County high school teachers to identify colleagues from their campus or other schools who do great work on behalf of the county’s arts students. We’d like to honor those named. MUSIC Mark Aguero teaches instrumental music at Century High School. Brian Akamine teaches choral […]
data.text:
With Varsity Arts coverage coming to an end, we asked Orange County high school teachers to identify colleagues from their campus or other schools who do great work on behalf of the county’s arts students. We’d like to honor those named.

MUSIC

Mark Aguero teaches instrumental music at Century High School.

Brian Akamine teaches choral music at Century High School.

Mike Alvarez teaches instrumental music at Whittier Christian High School.

David Amrein teaches instrumental music at JSerra Catholic High School.

“David is a very kind and inspiring teacher! Always gentle and yet a wonderful musician with great ideas!” – Brian Dehn

Sarah Anderson teaches vocal music at John F. Kennedy High School.

Scott Arakawa teaches instrumental music at Orange High School.

Jonathan Arnold teaches choral music and handbells at Cornelia Connelly School.

“Jonathan Arnold brings out the best in each of his students and makes music accessible for each of them no matter what level they are at. He has taught so many students and enabled them to feel positive about something they’ve never experienced before.” – Pamela Toomey

Megan Arthurton teaches vocal music at Valencia High School.

Bob Avzaradel teaches band and orchestra at Irvine High School.

“Bob’s ensembles are filled with wonderful, accomplished musicians and great people. Whether it is in a symphonic band, orchestra or jazz ensemble, he consistently inspires his students to excel while remaining calm and keeping a positive attitude. He is approachable and very supportive. I believe he is a great role model for his students and colleagues.” – Andy Julian

Sarkis Baltaian is the instrumental music associate director at the Orange County School of the Arts.

Kevin Bachelder teaches instrumental music at Tarbut V’Torah Community Day School.

Andrew Ball teaches vocal music at Corona del Mar High School.

Joseph Bartell teaches instrumental music at Brea Olinda High School.

Leslie Benjamin teaches choral and instrumental music at Savanna High School.

Amanda Bistolfo teaches choral music at Mater Dei High School.

Rob Blaney teaches vocal music at Woodbridge High School.

“Rob has worked so hard developing a strong vocal department. He has such a way with his students, incorporating strong teaching and wonderful lessons. His students feel a sense of home in his classes. He has more than doubled the amount of students in vocal music since his tenure at Woodbridge.” – Brad Harris

Joslynne Blasdel teaches instrumental music at Woodbridge High School.

“She is so dedicated to her students. She demands excellence and the students thrive under her direction.” – Brad Harris

Jill Brenner teaches vocal music at Irvine High School.

Janelle Burris teaches vocal music at Whittier Christian High School.

Michael Burrows teaches band and piano at Servite High School.

“Mike loves music and is able to teach even the most beginning student. He is versatile and can play just about any instrument. He’s done a wonderful job of developing our band program.” – Olga Hofreiter

Renee Cahill teaches choral music at Servite High School.

“Her passion for music and how it brings out the best in people and strengthens our relationship with God and with each other.” – Olga Hofreiter

Andrea Calvo teaches choir, guitar, rock band and theater at Ladera Vista Junior High School of the Arts.

“Full disclosure: Mrs. Calvo is my wife and soul mate; I love her very much. But that’s not what makes her great! She is great because she loves to teach music and theater. I’ve witnessed her teaching and she brings incredible joy and heart to each and every class.

“A veteran teacher of over 15 years, Mrs. Calvo still manages to bring high energy and enthusiasm to her lessons. She has an incredible choir program. Her students learn to sing with maturity, sensitivity and a level of musicality that is rare in young singers. She is a big advocate for arts in the community and was essential to the school’s receiving the status of Exemplary School by the Arts School Network. Mrs. Calvo teaches students more than just music or theater. She teaches them discipline, self respect, teamwork, determination, perseverance and dedication. She instills a growth mindset in her pupils so that they never stop wanting to learn, and they never develop a diva attitude. Watching her students learn and interact with each other is always a pleasure. – Francisco Calvo

Francisco Calvo teaches choir and is the performing arts department chairperson at Santa Margarita Catholic High School.

“Francisco inspires his students through his expert musicianship but more importantly, by being a role model in the spirit of our school’s charism, Caritas Christi. Francisco cares about his students and understands that the mission of an arts teacher transcends the obvious skill development. The mission is to help students discover who they are called to be in their lives and how they might use their gifts and talents to make our world a better place. As a colleague, Francisco is a leader with deep insight and great vision. It is a privilege to work and collaborate with him.” – Amy Luskey Barth

Chris Carbajal teaches band and music theory at St. Margaret’s Episcopal School.

“Chris has been a full-time music teacher and the band director at St. Margaret’s since 2003. He is a beloved teacher who is known for his sense of style and his incredible saxophone performances. His students develop solid musical skills and take ownership of their ensembles as they grow as musicians. He leads the casual Tartan James and performs frequently throughout the region as a professional jazz musician.” – Michele Silverman

Megan Carvale teaches vocal music at Orange Lutheran High School.

“(When I was her student,) she taught me how to listen, and music became my lifeline at that stage in my life.” – Crysti Everhart

Ben Case teaches instrumental music at Northwood High School.

Joseph Castillo teaches instrumental music at Troy High School.

Jeremy Chung teaches instrumental music at Laguna Beach High School.

Amalia Cisneros teaches classical voice at Orange County School of the Arts.

Eddy Clement is an accompanist at Los Alamitos High School.

“Eddy is a true professional. He is such a hard worker and is a very talented musician. He has been pivotal to the success and growth of the Los Alamitos choral program. During his 16.5 years as an accompanist at Los Alamitos, the choral program has been named national show choir champions eight times.” – David Moellenkamp

Kathy Cobb-Woll teaches vocal music at Santa Ana High School.

“Kathy Cobb-Woll is one of the most devoted, dedicated educators I have ever met. Her commitment to her students is unparalleled. She goes above and beyond to provide her students with a first-class vocal music education that includes private lessons and master classes. Her students are consistently chosen to perform at Disneyland’s Candlelight Ceremony and they have been selected a few times to perform at Carnegie Hall in New York City. These accomplishments would be amazing for any vocal music program, but in the case of Santa Ana High School, where almost all vocal music students enter with no training or experience performing prior to ninth grade, it is astounding. I also know that beyond her exceptional music program, students that need help with clothes or food or other expenses have been able to turn to Mrs. Cobb-Woll for assistance. Her generosity for her students is without bounds. It would be hard to find a teacher more invested in her students’ well-being than Kathy Cobb-Woll. There are generations of students that have come through her vocal music program that are better human beings because of her influence.” – Terry Schwinge

J.P. Combs teaches choir and band at Ocean View High School.

“Mr. Combs’ commitment to his students and music program is shown through the countless hours he puts in during and after school on a daily basis. Under his direction, the band program has more than doubled in size and quality, with the concert band and jazz bands winning numerous awards throughout Southern California and the marching band winning three consecutive state championships in their division.” – Adrian Lopez

Jennifer Connell teaches vocal music at Saddleback High School.

Jessica Cosley teaches vocal music at Valley High School.

Josinaldo Costa teaches classical guitar at Servite High School.

Carolyn Davidson teaches instrumental music at Orange Coast Musical Arts.

Brad Davis teaches marching band at Esperanza High School.

Harry Davis teaches visual arts at Villa Park High School.

Tyler Dawson teaches music at Crean Lutheran High School.

Daniel de Arakal is the guitar program coordinator at the Orange County School of the Arts.

Victor De Los Santos teaches instrumental music at Santa Ana High School.

Chelsea Dehn teaches choral music at Foothill High School.

“Easily one of the greatest teachers in this county. Her amazing report with her students have created one of the greatest choral programs in the area. She is unmatched in her grace, taste and musical excellence.” – Brian Dehn

Brian Dehn teaches choral music and handbells at JSerra Catholic High School.

Jeff Derus teaches vocal music at Anaheim High School.

Moana Dherlin teaches choral music at Los Alamitos High School.

Jerome Dieboldt teaches instrumental music at Sonora High School.

Brent Dodson teaches instrumental music at Sage Hill School.

“Brent Dodson is an exceptionally skilled musician and educator who joined the Sage Hill community in 2014. Dr. Dodson has taught music performance, appreciation and theory, and has held positions at Bard, Luther Waldorf, and Santa Monica colleges. Previously, he was a teaching artist with the Los Angeles Philharmonic. Dr. Dodson studied trumpet at The Juilliard School in New York, where he earned both a bachelor’s and a master’s degree in music performance. He also holds a doctorate in musical arts from USC. He asks his students to explore all kinds of new challenges in music, and they routinely dive right in without hesitation. The result is that they grow so much as musicians over the course of their time at Sage Hill, and that is so much fun to see AND hear!” – Kelly Parker

Scott Domingues teaches instrumental music at Loara High School.

Amanda Duncan teaches instrumental music at Santa Margarita Catholic High School.

Carol Duralde teaches vocal music at Yorba Linda High School.

Megan Eddy teaches choral music at Sage Hill School.

“Megan Eddy has been at Sage Hill since 2002 and has extensive experience in choral conducting, which is one of the main reasons she is such an excellent and patient educator. She taught at El Camino College, served as an associate conductor and music educator for the South Bay Children’s Choir, worked briefly with the Pacific Chorale and is currently a member of the Long Beach Camarata. She is a member of the Eta Chapter of Pi Kappa Lambda National Music Honor Society and is affiliated with the American Choral Directors Association, the Southern California Vocal Association and Chorus America. She earned her bachelor’s degree in music education from Chapman University and a master’s degree in choral conducting from USC. Some students call Ms. Eddy the best teacher at Sage Hill. She leads the Sage Hill Singers, and her choir students look forward to her classes and say they ‘rock!’” – Kelly Parker

Michael Fenton teaches vocal music guitar, and musical theater at Esperanza High School.

Michael Fisk teaches instrumental music at Tustin High School.

Catherine Forbush teaches piano at JSerra Catholic HIgh School.

“Ms. Forbush is one of the most talented keyboard artists in Orange County. Not only is she a phenomenal pianist in her own right but her ability in the classroom is pure perfection. She works with beginning students and advanced alike pushing each to achieve more than they thought possible. Her easygoing personality is amazingly juxtaposed with an intense passion for repertoire and technique — she is the perfect embodiment of high standards with a caring heart!” – Brian Dehn

Cristiana Franzetti teaches choir at Edison High School.

Kari Galeener teaches choir and piano at Garden Grove High School.

Alan Garcia teaches vocal music at Magnolia High School.

Bincins Garcia teaches instrumental music at Yorba Linda High School.

“Bincins Garcia is a phenomenal teacher and leader. He inspires his students to become the incredible performers that they are, and is a consummate professional who leads by example. Bincins gives hours above and beyond what is required so that his students have the opportunity to compete in several different competitions. He fosters a sense of family within all of his classes, getting to know each student by name and on a personal level. Many of his students spend their break and lunch hanging out in his room. Bincins is not only dedicated to his students, but to the faculty and staff at YLHS. He is one of the first to volunteer for any of our on-campus activities. I am so proud to call him my colleague and friend.” – Cathy Petz

Breysi Garcia teaches instrumental music and is the visual and performing arts department chairperson at Anaheim High School.

Frank Garcia teaches band and orchestra and is the performing arts department chairperson at Los Amigos High School.

Raul Garcia teaches instrumental music at Segerstrom High School.

Gregg Gilboe teaches marching band at Huntington Beach High School and orchestra for the Huntington Beach Academy for the Performing Arts.

“Gregg Gilboe has been at Huntington Beach High longer than all of the APA faculty. He juggles many events between the band and orchestra, specifically as a big presence in the community and integral aspect of APA’s main stage musicals and (pop music) concerts. His award-winning marching band provides tradition and entertainment in the Fourth of July Parade, Veterans Day ceremony and most recently, the Norman L. Worthy Park re-dedication gathering in downtown HB. Gregg deeply appreciates and respects classical music and instills the same sentiments in his students.” – Emily Iverson

Sandy Gilboe teaches marching band and jazz band at Costa Mesa High School.

“Sandy Gilboe has been at CMHS for 28 years! She has developed a program that welcomes all students into the world of instrumental music and teaches them not only how to play their instruments, but how to perform, and a love of music. Her students are a tight family, and she is respected and loved by all of them! Simply, they are fortunate to have such a dedicated and passionate teacher teaching them every day!” – Gregg Gilboe

“For 25+ years Sandy has defined quality instrumental music in Newport Mesa Unified School District. Whether through an award-winning marching band, a widely sought after jazz band or other instrumental music groups, Sandy engages and teaches students in what it means to be a part of something bigger than oneself.” – Kirby Piazza

Suzanne Gindin teaches string orchestra, marching band and color guard, jazz ensemble, guitar ensemble and music theory at Canyon High School.

“Dr. Gindin in just her second year at Canyon High School is already starting to grow the band program and expose our band students to new opportunities and experiences. She brings a wealth of experience to her classroom each day to share with her students.” – Craig Abercrombie

Erin Girard teaches choral music at Capistrano Valley High School.

“She has a passion for what she teaches, a love for her students, and she keeps her classes fun and promotes a family atmosphere.” – Emily Tucker

Brian Glahn teaches instrumental music at El Modena High School.

“Brian Glahn’s dedication to his students and his program has resulted in award-winning field shows and winter guard programs. His program is growing, with the largest orchestra class he’s had so far. He enjoys the commitment of his students and their parents, who provide support for all the band’s activities.” – Deborah Gillen

Alex Graham teaches TV and video production at Canyon High School.

“The students in the TV and video production program at Canyon High School are extremely lucky to have access to Mr. Graham’s knowledge and experience in the video production industry. His students have access to industry standard equipment and constantly produce pieces that are recognized locally as well as at the state and national levels.” – Craig Abercrombie

Eric Graham teaches vocal music at Marina High School.

Greg Grant teaches instrumental music at Laguna Hills High School.

Sarah Grenier teaches instrumental and vocal music at Ensign Intermediate School.

“She makes great use of technological resources in the classroom to make music learning diverse, fun and different in our community. She also makes a great collaboration partner between our schools!” – Jeffrey Ledon

Don Gunderson teaches music at Connections Academy.

Judy Gunderson teaches music at Connections Academy.

Melanie Hagen-Ching teaches vocal music at Rancho Alamitos High School.

Julie Hahn teaches music at Hope School.

Donn Hallman teaches marching band for Orange Coast Musical Arts.

Zach Halop teaches choral music at Northwood High School.

Grace Han teaches vocal music at Segerstrom High School.

Keith Hancock teaches choral music at Tesoro High School.

“Mr. Hancock is the most current recipient of the Grammy Music Educator award — this is no small feat! For over a decade he has grown his program to be one of the best in the area and when you watch him with his students you quickly see how much they love him and how much he inspires in them!” – Brian Dehn

Retired teacher John Hannan taught instrumental music at Mission Viejo High School.

“John taught instrumental music at Mission for 25 years and his main concern was always his students. He led the MVHS instrumental program to local, state and national championships and was a founding member of the WBA. He believed in being able to give his students a variety of opportunities to perform and each year made the musical theater production a collaborative learning experience for the musicians and actors by showing them how important it was to work together. He never settled for anything but the best.” – Kathy Harris

Pam Hansen teaches creative worship at Orange Lutheran High School.

“She always connects the message behind the music, and that adds a richer experience in her classroom.” – Crysti Everhart

Dylan Harlan teaches instrumental music at Katella High School.

Jason Harney teaches vocal music at Aliso Niguel High School.

Kenneth Haro teaches vocal music at Trabuco Hills High School.

Brad Harris teaches instrumental music at Woodbridge High School.

Corey Heddon teaches instrumental music at University High School.

Scott Hedgecock teaches choral music at Fullerton Union High School.

Kent Helwig is a pianist and vocal coach at Mater Dei High School.

“He goes out of his way time and time again to make sure students are prepared for auditions, master classes, competitions and other outside ventures. He works endless hours to ensure these students have the best experience possible.” – Stefan Miller

Sandra Hench teaches instrumental music at Western High School.

Mark Henson teaches vocal music at Troy High School.

Rob Henthorn teaches instrumental music and the history of rock ‘n’ roll at Newport Harbor High School.

Arwen Hernandez teaches instrumental music at Edison High School.

Joaquin Hernandez teaches instrumental music at Valley High School.

Brian Hogan teaches vocal music at Oxford Academy.

Judy Huang teaches piano and chamber music at the Orange County School of the Arts.

“She has an exceptional commitment to excellence and a genuine care for all her students.” – Sarkis Baltaian

Gary Hung teaches orchestra at Esperanza High School.

Mark Irons teaches instrumental music at Fountain Valley High School.

Val Jamora teaches instrumental music at Corona del Mar High School.

Aaron Jaramillo teaches vocal music at Laguna Hills High School.

Charles Jay teaches instrumental music at Villa Park High School.

Albert Jeung teaches instrumental music at Aliso Niguel High School.

Kim Johnson teaches vocal music at Saddleback Valley Christian School.

Ron Johnson teaches instrumental music at Orange Coast Musical Arts.

Roland Jones teaches instrumental music at Tustin High School.

David Joseph teaches choral music at Pacifica High School.

“Dave is one of the most beloved teachers on our campus. His rapport with students is undeniable, but more importantly, his ability to gain their trust is impressive. Students who have never sung before are willing to try and possibly embarrass themselves (a fate worse than death to a high school student) to achieve a great result. We have an impressive series of choral classes, from beginning to our award-winning show choir, which is a favorite based on their original concepts and tongue-in-cheek humor. He’s also a joy to work with and has insights that have propelled our VAPA program into a much higher performance arena. I appreciate all he does for our students and our campus.” – Joe Miller

Andy Julian teaches instrumental music at Trabuco Hills High School.

Richard Kay teaches instrumental music at Pacific Academy.

Joseph Kaye teaches instrumental music at Santa Ana High School.

Jackie Kearns teaches vocal music at Rosary Academy.

Eric Keawekane teaches visual arts at Los Amigos High School.

Caitlen Kemble teaches vocal music at San Clemente High School.

Jim Keltner teaches vocal music at Bolsa Grande High School.

Richard King teaches instrumental music at Valencia High School.

Jordan Kirby teaches choral music at Crean Lutheran High School.

Jamie Knight teaches music technology at the Huntington Beach Academy for the Performing Arts.

“Jamie Knight is the genius behind APA’s music, media and entertainment technology program. He has the distinction of being an outstanding Apple educator. Jamie is creative and thinks outside the box. He works tirelessly to create opportunities for students, and his knowledge of classic rock is beyond compare.” – Stacy Robison

Sean Knight teaches instrumental music at Saddleback High School.

Jesse Knowles teaches music at Troy High School.

Jim Kollias teaches instrumental music and is the visual and performing arts chairperson at Beckman High School.

“Jim Kollias is a man with a singular vision: to develop and nurture the next generation of artists, art patrons and arts educators. As a result of Jim’s vision and leadership as visual and performing arts department chairperson, Beckman High School is a comprehensive public high school that embraces what is articulated as the school’s backbone: the four A’s – Academics, Athletics, Activities and the Arts. Because of Jim, our visual and performing arts department is recognized as one of the strongest departments within a school whose academic success is well-known throughout the county.

“Beyond Beckman High, two decades ago, Jim was responsible for single-handedly resurrecting instrumental music programs across the district and five years ago facilitated the establishment of an annual Philharmonic Invitational High School Orchestra Festival at the Segerstrom Concert Hall.

“And, last but not least, as a veteran arts educator of 35+ years, never before had I been engaged in art department discussions of such a profound nature. Never to rest on the accolades of the past, Jim continues to push the visual and performing arts department to the next level. This year’s departmental focus recognizes that many of our students demonstrate a very high degree of technical skill rooted in historical knowledge and aesthetic understanding; however, is that art? With support of Jim and the other members of the department we will be addressing ‘What is artistry and how do we ‘teach’ it?’” – Karen Akashi

Kent Lam teaches instrumental music at Santiago High School.

Gabriel Lawson teaches music theory, opera and chorale at the Orange County School of the Arts.

“Gabriel is constantly looking for ways to improve our curriculum and instruction. He consistently develops innovative ways to teach theory to our students and provides ways for his partner teachers to improve their instruction. Gabriel is selfless in his pursuit of augmenting student instructional time and the product of their work. He devises clever and engaging ways to present student work that reflects both educational philosophies and artistic sensibilities. He also takes a very personal approach to his student relationships and provides opportunities for students to express themselves and share their feelings in addition to developing their artistic expression.” – Ryan Reithmeier

Maria Lazarova teaches classical voice and is the dean of the arts conservatories at the Orange County School of the Arts.

“Maria genuinely cares and is very invested in the development of the classical voice conservatory. Over the course of her tenure as the director of classical voice, she built this program from the ground up, introducing a well-rounded curriculum based on university music programs, providing both academic and performance based classes, such as theory, music history, diction, art song literature and even vocal jazz. She was able to provide amazing performance opportunities through various opera productions and tours, establish a voice lesson scholarship, as well as provide excellent guidance to all classical voice students. Many students who graduated from this program under her care are now attending some of the most prestigious schools of music in the nation, such as Julliard, the San Francisco Conservatory and the Thornton School of Music at USC. It is no wonder that she is now the dean of the arts conservatories, as all arts conservatories will now benefit and grow under her leadership.” – Amalia Cisneros

Jeffrey Ledón teaches choir at Newport Harbor High School.

Grace Lee teaches instrumental music at University High School.

Larry Lenard teaches instrumental music at Bethel Baptist School.

Jon Lindfors teaches choir and piano at Costa Mesa High School.

“Jon puts in hours of time and effort to make sure his students are successful. His classroom is warm and welcoming, students love him, and he contributes to all things in the arts during faculty meetings. He makes his co-workers feel special by celebrating their birthdays and it is an honor to work with him.” – Cynthia Kaska

“Jon Lindfors is an institution in choral music in the Newport Mesa Unified School District! For over 25 years, he has created programs for student performers that wed the traditional with the contemporary, the solemn with the humorous, and the recognized with the obscure. He expands students intellect and horizons through the beauty of song.” – Kirby Piazza

Brenda Loh teaches instrumental music at Segerstrom High School.

“Brenda is a patient and inspiring teacher who includes global and social awareness as a part of her teaching philosophy. She encourages cross cultural activities among several of her students who communicate with pen pals in foreign countries. In addition, she often uses her summer vacation to travel world wide to underdeveloped countries where she helps raise funds and helps deliver aid as well as global awareness about their situations.” – Roger Gordon

Shaun Lopez teaches instrumental music at Valley Vista High School.

Andy Magana teaches instrumental music at Tesoro High School.

Ovidiu Marinca teaches instrumental music at Fairmont Preparatory.

Anabel Martinez teaches vocal music at Los Amigos High School.

Matt Matthews teaches instrumental music at Fountain Valley High School.

Ariel May teaches choral music at Canyon High School.

“Ms. May single-handedly revived the choir program at Canyon High School in just a few short years. Her program has grown three-fold since her arrival. Not only has participation in her program grown, but so have the accolades her students have received for their amazing performances.” – Craig Abercrombie

“Ariel is passionate in teaching her students. She’s engaging and proficient in having students learn the art of song and expressing through the voice.” – Andrea Greene

Dean McElroy teaches instrumental music at San Juan Hills High School.

“Mr. McElroy is able to reach students from all different backgrounds and ability levels with his instrumental music program. He is a master at inspiring students to work hard, practice hard and dream large. One of the most special projects of his program is that his band and orchestra students get together to do full orchestral pieces. He also is a great collaborator who works with his students during our musicals to give them real-life pit-playing experience. The warm environment and high standards that Mr. McElroy expects sets the stage for an amazing instrumental music program.” – Cambria Beilstein

“Dean pushes his kids to their limit. He helps the kids reach their full potential each year. His kids get specific training from professionals in the industry to improve their mastery of their instrument. His musicians sound pristine in concert and have been invited to play in famous festivals. I feel honored to have a colleague with so many years of experience in the arts to look up to.” – Kristine Calder

John McGilligan teaches marching band at Marina High School.

Jeanette McMahon teaches vocal music and is the visual and performing arts chairperson at Godinez Fundamental High School.

“Jeanette McMahon has been at Godinez since it opened, helped start up the school, and has built the music department from the ground up. She is an extremely effective and powerful leader, both with students and staff. She is responsible for the stellar vocal music program at Godinez. Working with Jeanette is a pleasure. She is energetic and extremely well organized. She has a fierce work ethic and encourages her peers to strive for the best. She was voted Teacher of the Year for 2011. Jeanette inspires her students to work hard, push boundaries, take risks and learn. She is always there for them. They will remember their experience with “Mac” as an important opportunity to grow in many ways, not only musically, but as people.” – Helen Seigel

Doug Meeuwsen teaches instrumental music at Mission Viejo High School.

Stacey Miles teaches choir at St. Margaret’s Episcopal School.

“Stacey Miles is loved by all of her students for her expert vocal instruction and for her ever-present humor. Students gather in her classroom and office as fun and collaborative spaces throughout the school days and after school. Every spring, she pours her heart and soul into the musical, coaching the cast members to sing beyond what anyone would think possible. She loves her students and creates meaningful opportunities for them to grow in their skills and to shine as performers.” – Michele Silverman

Brandon Miller teaches instrumental music at El Toro High School.

Jeremy Miller teaches instrumental music at Edison High School.

Joe Miller teaches instrumental music at Pacifica High School.

John Miller teaches instrumental music at Bolsa Grande High School.

Justin Miller teaches vocal music at Mater Dei High School.

Marian Mine teaches choir at Brethren Christian High School.

“Ms. Mine trains students from middle school to high school chamber choir to attain high levels of excellence. Her students have participated in honor choirs, traveled to Japan in performance and benefited from professional guest artists who performed for choir concerts. She encourages students to see music as an act of worship to God.” – Stella Griffin

Deanna Miner teaches instrumental music at Oxford Academy.

David Moellenkamp teaches choral music at Los Alamitos High School.

Len Montgomery teaches instrumental music at Brethren Christian High School.

“With his magnetic personality and dedication to excellence, Mr. Montgomery has led students to attain the highest music awards and has retained the loyalty of his alumni over 29 years at Brethren.” – Stella Griffin

David Montoya teaches choral music at La Habra High School.

Phil Mortensen teaches orchestra at Yorba Linda High School.

Stacy Neacato teaches music at Estancia High School.

Xavier Nguyen teaches instrumental music at Unity Middle College High School.

Ashley No teaches vocal music at Fairmont Preparatory.

Sarah Norris teaches choral music at Mission Viejo High School.

Stacy Oh teaches vocal music at Villa Park High School.

Cathy Olinger teaches instrumental music at Tesoro High School.

Justin Olvey teaches vocal music at University High School.

Justin Padilla teaches jazz and orchestra at Los Alamitos High School.

Josh Parsons teaches instrumental music at John F. Kennedy High School.

John Pavasars teaches music at Hope School.

David Peay teaches vocal music at Tustin High School.

Tina Peterson teaches choral music at Irvine High School.

Tom Plunkett teaches marching band at Los Alamitos High School.

Jonathan Pratt teaches orchestra and band at Crean Lutheran High School.

“He is well respected among students and loves offering more opportunities for his students.” – Alyssa Jones

James Quirion teaches instrumental music and is the visual and performing arts chairperson at Cypress High School.

“James is dedicated to our school and his program. He guides hundreds of marching band, percussion and tall flags/pageantry students every day, including during band camp all summer. Our marching band even appeared in the 2015 Tournament of Roses Parade, which filled all of us, students and staff, with pride! In addition to his numerous duties, he mentors newer band teachers, including many who go on to start their own programs elsewhere in our area. Furthermore, he often serves as an adjudicator at music competitions in the area, further spreading his knowledge. Finally, Mr. Quirion is a devoted husband and father, a job he would say he values most of all.” – Kristy Takacs

“James has developed the Cypress Centurion Imperial Brigade into a musical powerhouse. They compete at the highest level successfully. A few years ago they marched in the Rose Parade, which is a very high honor. James holds a master’s degree in music and also does adjudication on the weekends. His knowledge and skill are in high demand. As the chair of the visual and performing arts department, he is a strong advocate for the choir teacher and students as well as for the fine arts and photography classes. James is an accomplished musician and plays the trumpet.” – Joanne Fawley

Ryan Reithmeier teaches classical voice at the Orange County School of the Arts.

Gretchen Rhue teaches instrumental and vocal music at Orange Coast Musical Arts.

“Gretchen pulls the children into the music and finds out how to increase their musical skills and strengthen their weaknesses. She’s incredibly creative and the children love her.” – Donn Hallman

David Rigsby teaches vocal music at Loara High School.

Ashley Riopka teaches vocal music at Costa Mesa High School.

Dave Roberts teaches vocal music at El Toro High School.

Chris Russell is the orchestra program coordinator at the Orange County School of the Arts.

Eric Samson teaches instrumental music at El Dorado High School.

Mark Santos teaches band and orchestra at Godinez Fundamental High School.

“Mark Santos is in his second year as director of instrumental music at Godinez Fundamental High School, and has been teaching music at the high school level for 11 years. At Godinez, Mark teaches marching band, three concert bands, chamber orchestra, and is the adviser for the Mariachi Club, Mariachi de Oro. Godinez did not have a marching band prior to Mark’s arrival at our school. He has put in countless hours to not only grow a marching band that numbers at almost 100 performers but also has started a color guard as well. He is a great asset to our music department and inspiration to his students! We are so happy he is on our team!” – Jeanette McMahon

Richie Sebastian teaches instrumental music at La Quinta High School.

Joey Sellers teaches jazz studies at Saddleback College.

“Pure genius! Joey has true passion for jazz and kids as demonstrated by what he provides his students and to those of us teaching in the K-12 system. We are so fortunate to have him in Orange County. He is an amazing composer and trombonist, too!” – Bob Avzaradel

Teren Shaffer teaches instrumental music and is the executive vice president of the school at the Orange County School of the Arts.

Robert Shetland teaches instrumental music at Buena Park High School.

Na-Young Shin teaches vocal music at Santiago High School.

Michael Short teaches choir at Orange High School.

“Mike Short has endless energy for everything that keeps kids singing at the highest levels of excellence. He is totally involved in the community, as well, which provides even more performance opportunities for his students. He conducts the Orange Master Chorale that performs the annual tree-lighting in Orange as well as the 3rd of July. His choirs regularly tour Europe. Every day, he is trying to do more for his students and for the community of Orange. Most of all, he does it all with a smile and never a bad word about anyone. His warmth and passion are the perfect mix for great teaching and great music making.” – Suzanne Gindin

Shelby Smith teaches vocal music at La Quinta High School.

Taylor Smith teaches instrumental music at Mater Dei High School.

Tracy Solis teaches choral music at El Modena High School.

“Tracy inspires her students to outstanding levels of performance, and her choirs have received high marks at the festivals they’ve attended. She also has welcomed special-needs students into her classroom, and fully integrated them into the Vanguard Choir. She cares about all her students, not only as singers but as people. She is a wonderful partner in co-directing El Modena musicals.” – Deborah Gillen

Tony Soto teaches instrumental music at San Clemente High School.

Dan St. Marseille is the instrumental music conservatory director at the Orange County School of the Arts.

Rachel St. Marseille is the commercial music coordinator at the Orange County School of the Arts.

Howard Stephens teaches instrumental music at Trabuco Hills High School.

Desmond Stevens teaches instrumental music at Portola High School.

“Mr. Stevens is one of the most supportive and inclusive arts educators I have every met. His students’ growth and development as musicians as well as human beings is surely in part because of the kindness and motivation he instills in them. He is constantly encouraging students to try new things and to challenge themselves. Our students and staff are lucky to have him!” – Megan Kirby

Andrew Stroud teaches classical guitar at Servite High School.

“Although he’s been teaching at the university level, he is now working with high school students so their love of classical guitar can begin sooner. He is skillful and relates well to students.” – Olga Hofreiter

Nancy Stück teaches choral music at Beckman High School.

“Our choral program has taken great strides since the opening of our school, thanks to Nancy’s leadership and teaching. Last year, she led her group to Carnegie Hall where her students performed magnificently. She always approaches each day with a smile and a belief that every student who comes through her doors can and will improve as a singer.” – Jim Kollias

Fr. Victor Szczurek teaches music and is the headmaster at St. Michael’s Preparatory School.

Terri Taaffe teaches music at Orangewood Academy.

Whitney Tavlarides teaches instrumental music at Northwood High School.

Matt Thacker teaches middle school band at Brethren Christian High School.

“Mr. Thacker’s program is the engine behind the successful BCHS high school band program. Students appreciate that he genuinely cares about each of them and that he is an excellent teacher.” – Stella Griffin

Danny Thomas teaches vocal music at Bethel Baptist School.

Tim Thomas teaches instrumental music at Foothill High School.

Whitney Ting teaches instrumental music at Sunny Hills High School.

“Whitney came to Sunny Hills eight years ago to a non-existent program. She single-handedly built an award-winning band, color guard and percussion group that competes every year winning top honors. She also directs the orchestra and symphonic band and supervises a program that involves over 200 students. Her program is one of the largest entities in the Sunny Hills conservatory of fine arts.” – Brian Wall

Kevin Tison teaches choral music at Fountain Valley High School.

Bruce Topping teaches instrumental music at Valencia High School.

Troy Trimble teaches instrumental music at Fullerton Union High School.

Michael Ushino teaches vocal music and guitar at San Juan Hills High School.

“Mr. Ushino works tirelessly to build his choir program into a fun collaborative place that his students can call home. He inspires them by constantly pushing them to achieve their best, and also provides a safe space for them when they falter. His teaching practice inspires the students and creates an environment where the end product is something amazing to hear.” – Cambria Beilstein

“Mike is such a fun teacher and has built a strong choir program. His singers sound incredible in their concerts and share his passion for music. He uses technology advances to enhance his teaching in the classroom and it’s working. His program continues to grow each year. I’m so proud of him.” – Kristine Calder

Derek Venlet teaches instrumental music at Irvine High School.

Kim Vo teaches instrumental music at Westminster High School.

Daniel Vu teaches vocal music at Orange Lutheran High School.

“He invests in students and teaches them that it’s OK to make mistakes.” – Crysti Everhart

Steve Wade teaches instrumental music at Dana Hills High School.

“Steve is an amazing musician and performer, but his passion and dedication to his instrumental music program is remarkable. He is at school routinely to make sure all of his performing groups have adequate rehearsal time, he spends weekends at competitions throughout the years, he plans performances at local community events, Disneyland, and throughout the county. His students hold the highest respect for him and come back frequently to visit once they’ve graduated. Steve’s impact on his students lasts a lifetime, and he has inspired many through his time at SOCSA.” – Samantha Sanford

Andy Waldukat teaches instrumental music and is the visual and performing arts department chair at Capistrano Valley High School.

“His dedication, the hours he works, he lives for his job and his students and loves music.” – Emily Tucker

Shannon Wallace teaches choir at McAulliffe Middle School.

“Shannon is pure joy. She is truly a talented teacher who loves her students and encourages success in each of her students. The Los Alamitos community is lucky to have Shannon as a choir director.” – Tom Plunkett

Sharon Wallace teaches vocal music at Bethel Baptist School.

Roxanna Ward teaches choral music at Laguna Beach High School.

Paul Wargo teaches vocal music at Western High School.

David Weinberg teaches instrumental music at Aliso Niguel High School.

Robert Westphal teaches instrumental music at Mission Viejo High School.

Michael Whang teaches instrumental music at Santa Margarita Catholic High School.

“Mr. Whang is the hardest-working teacher I know. He works 12-15 hours a day, six days a week. He is an incredible collaborator and a brilliant musician and teacher. When there wasn’t enough practice space on the football fields for his marching band, he measured and painted a completely different (to scale) practice field for his band. Even the head football coach couldn’t believe it and was so impressed! Nobody thought there was enough room! But with his ingenuity and determination, Mr. Whang got the job done. For the spring musical, Mr. Whang graciously volunteers to give up his classroom and rehearsal space so that we can convert the band room into an orchestra pit for the theater production. He is a role model for his students. Now in his 11th year at the high school, he continues to give 100 percent of his time, talent and energy. The program continues to grow under his leadership. Under his direction, the symphony orchestra (which he created) has performed major works by Dvorak, Beethoven, Bernstein and Schubert. This year, he has accepted an invitation for the orchestra to perform at Carnegie Hall. Without a doubt, the program is better because of him. Bravo, Mr. Whang!” – Francisco Calvo

John Whatley teaches music at Westminster High School.

Dave Whitmire teaches vocal music at Liberty Christian School.

Gene Wie teaches orchestra at St. Margaret’s Episcopal School.

“Gene teaches upper-school chamber music and chamber honors, as well as computer science. In addition to his classroom teaching, Gene is constantly enriching the school and local community with his passion for music. He takes upper-school orchestra students to preschools around the region to introduce young children to various instruments and performs with his students at senior centers. He collaborates with the OC Youth Symphony Orchestra, takes students to Disney recording sessions annually, oversees the Piano Academy and Suzuki Academy and has worked with students to customize a prosthetic 3D printed limb for a young violinist.” – Michele Silverman

Phillip Wightman teaches instrumental music at La Habra High School.

Alex Willert teaches choral music at Brea Olinda High School.

Retired teacher Dave Willert taught choral music at Brea Olinda High School.

“He is an inspiration – always positive, hard-working and passionate” – Janae West

Chris Winn is the accompanist and musical director at Santa Margarita Catholic High School.

“Chris Winn is the epitome of a generous and kind soul. He is willing to go the extra mile for his students and gives of his time cheerfully playing piano sometimes for hours at a time. It has been my honor to work with Chris at both Tri-School Theater and SMCHS for over a combined period of time of 20 years. He is a gift from God with a glorious voice and a joyful heart. He truly ‘makes a joyful noise unto the Lord.’” – Amy Luskey Barth

“Chris Winn is the epitome of artistry and compassion. He is a brilliant musician, an excellent teacher, and brings out the best in everyone around him. The students adore him! Chris is an absolute joy to work with here at Santa Margarita.” – Amanda Duncan

Ray Woods teaches vocal music at Dana Hills High School.

“Ray is an institution at Dana Hills. He has been a rock, a mentor, an advocate, a friend, and a leader for our performing arts program. He is a caring teacher and staff member, a dedicated director and a passionate mentor. He takes special interest in his students and coaches them through their high school experience. Ray’s passion for music has encouraged many of his students to continue their music education and even go on to pursue music education degrees. His dedication to the community, his students and the environment at Dana Hills is irreplaceable.” – Samantha Sanford

Aaron Yim teaches instrumental music at Magnolia High School.

Ryan Yoder teaches choral music at El Dorado High School.

Ainur Zabenova teaches instrumental music at Pacific Academy.

Aaron Zeilinger teaches instrumental music at Orange Lutheran High School.

“He shares the value of camaraderie, friendships and leadership in his music classes every day.” – Crysti Everhart
